definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: Who was it said that good could not come out of evil ?
sentences.chinese: 恶行生不出善果来，是谁讲过这句话来着？

sentences.english: Because of the sin that I had committed, I have hurt you badly.
sentences.chinese: 由于我所犯下的恶行，我给你们带来了重大伤害。

sentences.english: Evil deeds may beget many fateful consequences.
sentences.chinese: 恶行会产生严重的后果。

sentences.english: I shall never attempt to palliate my own foible by exposing the error of another .
sentences.chinese: 你不能用别人的恶行来掩饰自己的劣迹。

sentences.english: I hearkened and heard, but they spake not aright: no man repented him of his wickedness, saying, What have I done?
sentences.chinese: 无人悔改恶行，说，我作的是什么呢。

sentences.english: Quite simply, equity will not suffer a wrong without a remedy.
sentences.chinese: 道理很简单，衡平法绝不容忍恶行零成本。

sentences.english: He abhors the idea but he considers it a necessary evil.
sentences.chinese: 他痛恨这种想法，但又认为这种恶行是必要的。

sentences.english: It is essential that we speak out loud and clear against such abuses.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须站出来大声疾呼，反对这种恶行。

sentences.english: Forewarned of evil, in other words, is half the battle against it.
sentences.chinese: 可见“事先警惕恶行是与之斗争成功的一半”。

sentences.english: Now if you'll excuse me, I've got first-class villainy to perform.
sentences.chinese: 现在，如果你不介意的话，我要表演一场一流的恶行。

sentences.english: The righteous is not innocent of the deeds of the wicked
sentences.chinese: 行善守法者在恶人恶行中并非纯洁无邪。

sentences.english: He believes it is a sin to waste food.
sentences.chinese: 他认为浪费粮食是罪恶行为。

sentences.english: Good deeds should be rewarded and evil deeds punished.
sentences.chinese: 功绩应予褒奖，恶行该受惩罚。

sentences.english: Xy:Now if you will excuse me, I've got first-class villainy to perform.
sentences.chinese: 现在，如果你不介意的话，我要表演一场一流的恶行。

sentences.english: They have depleted me through the constant assault of corruption and nefarious practices.
sentences.chinese: 他们通过腐败和罪恶行为不断攻击我终于耗尽了我。

sentences.english: Most religions consider lying and stealing to be sins.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的宗教认为说谎和偷窃是罪恶行为。

definition: bad record (esp. of a public official)/unsavory track record
so many that the bamboo slats have been exhausted/innumerable crimes (idiom)/see also 罄筆難書|罄笔难书[qing4 bi3 nan2 shu1]
lit. strung through and filled with evil (idiom); filled with extreme evil/replete with vice/guilty of monstrous crimes
